task: Line $k$ is defined by $ y = 10x - 7 $. Line $j$ is perpendicular to line $k$ in the xy-plane. What is the slope of line $j$?
explanation:
Choice C is correct. Since line $j$ is perpendicular to line $k$, its slope is the opposite reciprocal of the slope of line $k$. 
The equation for line $k$ is given as $ y = 10x - 7 $, meaning its slope is $ 10 $. 
The opposite reciprocal of $ 10 $ is $ - rac{1}{10} $. 
Thus, the slope of line $j$ is $ - rac{1}{10} $.
